wikipedia_page.main: Ellen Mary Clerke (26 September 1840 – 2 March 1906) was an accomplished poet, linguist and a journalist. She was the daughter of Catherine Mary Deasy, whose father was a wealthy brewer and shipbuilder in the town of Clonakilty, and John William Clerke (c. 1814–1890), a bank manager of Anglo-Irish descent in Skibbereen, and later a Registrar for his brother-in-law, Richard Morgan Deasy, a High-Court Judge.

response: *March 2 – Ellen Mary Clerke, English novelist, poet and writer on astronomy (born 1840)
* 2 March – Ellen Mary Clerke, author, journalist, poet, and science writer (born 1840).
* Ellen Mary Clerke (1840–1906), Irish poet, linguist and journalist
* September 20 – Ellen Mary Clerke (died 1906), Irish author, journalist, poet and science writer
*20 September – Ellen Mary Clerke, author, journalist, poet and science writer (died 1906).
